description: Ms. codex. Title supplied by cataloger from title of Text 1 (fol. 1a) and Text 2 (fol. 25a). Physical description: Number of lines per page varies. Written in black ink with use of red. European paper, glossy. Inscription in Roman script on a spine label (vertical): "AUT S 80" (repeated on the pastedown of the upper cover). Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Sh 157" (repeated on the pastedown of the upper cover). Several ijāzāt for Aḥmad Najīb, one from Muḥammad Ḥayāh al-Sindī al-Madanī (fol. 29b) ; one from Muḥammad ibn al-Ṭayyib (fol. 30b-31b). Origin: Copy of Text 1 completed on Wednesday 8 Dhū al-Ḥijjah 1162 [Nov. 19, 1749] in al-Madīnah al-Munawwarah, by Yūsuf ibn Muṣṭafá al-Madanī al-MṬūbisī(?), teacher ("muʻallim al-aṭfāl") (colophon, fol. 24a). Copy of Text 4 completed on 23 Jumādá al-Thāniyah 1162 [June 10, 1749], by al-ḥājj Aḥmad Najīb ibn al-ḥājj Muḥammad ibn Muṣṭafá ibn Muḥammad, whose father was qāḍī bi-ṭayyibatihi al-Ṭayyibah al-Ṭāhirah (colophon, fol. 40b). Copy of Text 5 completed in Jumādá al-Thānī 1162 [May-June 1749] by Yūsuf ibn Muṣṭafá al-MṬūbisī, in al-Madīnah al-Sharīfah (colophon, fol. 67b).
author: Sindī, Muḥammad Ḥayāt, d. 1750
abstract: Collections of texts written by several hands on readings and on legal questions. The first text is a collection of beginnings of collections of ḥadīth (Ṣaḥīḥ al-Bukhārī, Ṣaḥīḥ Muslim, Jāmiʻ al-Tirmidhī, etc.).
contents: 5. fol. 42a-67b : Ismāʻ al-ṣumm fī ithbāt al-sharaf min qibal al-umm / taʼlīf ... Abū ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad ibn ... Abī Zayd ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Marrakushī al-Ḍarīr al-Mālikī. -- Mach, R. Yahuda, no. 1373.
extent: 71 leaves : paper ; 215 x 160 mm. bound to 218 x 165 mm.
title: Awāʼil al-kutub al-sittah. Thabat al-shaykh Muḥammad Ḥayāh al-Sindī al-aṣl al-Madanī ... [etc.].
provenance: From the books of ʻAbd al-Muḥsin al-KhLī (ownership statement dated 1256(?) H. [1840 or 41] on fol. 1a). Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
creator: سندي، محمد حياة
subject: Muslim scholars—Certification—History—Saudi Arabia—Medina—18th century—Sources
binding_note: Paper over paper pasteboards for upper and lower covers, with brown leather and cloth for spine and edges. Re-used paper pastedowns.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
